page.title: 01TORTHORWALD
page.content: Torthorwald village lies between Dumfries and Lochmaben.The surrounding area is mainly rural. Most of the land is used for grazing, both intensively managed, and rough. Dairy and beef cattle, and sheep are kept. An old airfield is used as an industrial estate, including an M.O.T. Station and weighbridge. Most people commute to work in Dumfries, or work locally on farms. The Lochar Moss is used as a dump. Although it is dangerous to explore, a local expert has informed us that rare plants and insects are to be found there. Birch trees predominate.
